com.percussion.pso.utils
Class PSOSimpleSqlQuery

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.pso.utils.PSOSimpleSqlQuery

public class PSOSimpleSqlQuery
extends Object

Prepares and executes a simple SQL Query using the standard Rhythmyx repository database. Queries can be provided in two ways:

  1. Using a SQL Statement, that may contain parameter placeholders (usually "?"). In this case, an array of parameter objects must be supplied. If no parameters are needed, the list must be empty
  2. Using an Internal Request. In this case, the request must have already been created. All parameters are passed as part of the create.

The Objects returned from these queries are mapped using the default JDBC type mapping, which differs based on database driver implementation. For example, SQL Server may return an Integer object for a numeric column where Oracle returns a BigDecimal. Since both of these classes are subclasses of Number, callers should assume that numeric values are Number objects unless they wish to perform other special handling, using reflection or similar methods.

This class makes no attempt to handle complex datatypes. Longs, CLOBs, Blobs, etc. are not handled.

Author:
DavidBenua

public static List<Object[]> doQuery(String query,
                                     List<? extends Object> params)
                              throws SQLException,
                                     NamingException
Perform a query with multiple rows.

Parameters:
query - the SQL statement.
params - a list of Objects that represent the placeholders in the SQL. Never null. May be empty.
Returns:
a List of Object[] representing the rows of the result set.
Throws:
SQLException
NamingException

                              throws com.percussion.data.PSInternalRequestCallException,
                                     SQLException
Perform a query based on an Internal Request. The query associated with the request is processed and returned as a list of Object[];

Parameters:
ir - the internal request.
Returns:
a List of Object[] representing the rows of the result set.

doSingleRowQuery

public static Object[] doSingleRowQuery(String query,
                                        List<? extends Object> params)
                                 throws SQLException,
                                        NamingException
Perform a query that returns only one row. If the query provided returns only one row, only the first row will be examined.

Parameters:
query - the SQL query.
params - a List of Objects that represent the parameters.
Returns:
an Object[] that represents the first row returned from the query. May be null.
Throws:
SQLException
NamingException

                                 throws SQLException,
                                        com.percussion.data.PSInternalRequestCallException
Perform an Internal Request query that returns only one row. If the query provided returns only one row, only the first row will be examined.

Parameters:
ir - the Internal Request.
Returns:
an Object[] representing the columns returned by the query. May be null
Throws:
SQLException
com.percussion.data.PSInternalRequestCallException

cleanupResult

private static void cleanupResult(ResultSet rs,
                                  Statement stmt,
                                  Connection conn)
                           throws SQLException
Clean up after a query. Closes the result sete, statement and connection, handles any errors and releases the connection back to the pool. Intended to be called in the finally clause.

Parameters:
rs - the result set. May be null
stmt - the statement. May be null
conn - the connection. May be null
Throws:
SQLException - if any errors occur.

setInternalParams

private static void setInternalParams(PreparedStatement stmt,
                                      List<? extends Object> params)
                               throws SQLException
Set the parameter list on a prepared statement. The mapping is done using the default JDBC Type/Object mapping. Note that no checking is done to assure that the required number of parameters are supplied.

Parameters:
stmt - the prepared statement. Must not be null
params - a List of Object suitable for the parameters. Must not be null but may be empty
Throws:
SQLException

buildRowResult

private static Object[] buildRowResult(ResultSet rs)
                                throws SQLException
build a result row as an Object[]. The size of the row is determined from the result set metadata. The object types are determined by the default JDBC type / object mapping.

Parameters:
rs - the result set. Must not be null
Returns:
the array of objects representing the current row of the result set.
Throws:
SQLException
